title: Champions League: Chelsea edges past Dortmund, Benfica routs Brugge
description: Chelsea kept their season alive by beating Borussia Dortmund 2-0 at Stamford Bridge to progress to the quarter-finals 2-1 on aggregate while Benfica advanced 7-1 on aggregate following its 2-0 win in the first leg in Belgium.

title: In France, warmer winter temperatures disrupt agricultural crops
description: With the winter of 2022-2023 ranking among the fifteen warmest on record since 1900, fruit tree growers must manage the impacts of shorter cold spells and temperature shocks.

title: In Georgia, thousands protest over controversial 'foreign agents' bill
description: The demonstration took place after Georgian lawmakers earlier Tuesday gave their initial backing to a draft law, which is reminiscent of Russia's legislation used to crack down on dissent.

title: Pension reform draws fresh record number of protesters across France
description: France's Interior Ministry said Tuesday's planned demonstrations had seen 1.28 million take to the streets, a number slightly higher number than the one compiled during a previous round of protests on January 31.

title: Following complaints, corsets will no longer be required for 'Bridgerton'
description: Actresses in the successful Netflix series complained about difficulty breathing, displaced organs and hindered movements due to the controversial historical garment.

title: At least 6 Palestinians killed in Israeli West Bank raid
description: An Israeli army raid in Jenin led to a gunbattle that killed at least six Palestinians and wounded more than two dozen others.

title: Israel faces unprecedented revolt of army reservists
description: In opposition to Benyamin Netanyahu's justice reform, former soldiers who are still regularly called up refuse to serve.

title: Pension reform: The left must propose that the financing of pensions no longer be solely based on work
description: Rejecting the proposed reform does not exempt the French left-leaning parties from looking for ways to bolster the pay-as-you-go system, according to Jean-François Debat, mayor of Bourg-en-Bresse (Parti Socialiste), in an op-ed for 'Le Monde.'

title: French pension reform: Unions want to strengthen movement without losing public support
description: Union calls for a rolling strike − which is synonymous with the disruption of economic activity and other inconviences − are driven by the gamble that it will not backfire on them.

title: Pritzker Architecture Prize awarded to David Alan Chipperfield
description: The field's highest honor was given to the British architect and urban planner, whose work was described as 'subtle yet powerful, subdued yet elegant.'

title: Female students remain barred from Afghan universities
description: The hard-line position was confirmed on the eve of campuses reopening, despite voices of dissent within the Taliban government.

title: Iran makes first arrests as school poisoning cases top 5,000
description: According to the government, people in five regions have been arrested but no identities or possible motive for the crimes, which have targeted female students, were given.

title: Two kidnapped Americans found dead in Mexico, 2 others alive
description: They were violently abducted last week in the northern Mexican border city of Matamoros after getting caught in the crossfire of rival cartel groups.

title: In Spain, corruption case weakens Socialist Party before local elections
description: A former MP of Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez's party allegedly took bribes in exchange for services to companies.

title: Opinion: French pension reform seen from Europe
description: European researchers from Sweden, Spain, Germany and the UK offer a nuanced vision of the specificities of the conflict over pension reform.

title: Pension reform protests: Map of the March 7 demonstrations across France
description: All the workers unions are calling for rolling strikes against President Macron's pension reform starting on March 7. Protests are scheduled all over France.

title: Turkish opposition finally unites against Erdogan ahead of May presidential elections
description: The leader of the Republican People's Party, Kemal Kilicdaroglu, has been nominated by a broad coalition of six parties ranging from the left to the nationalist right.

title: French Pension reform: What is happening with the bill?
description: After two months of heated debates in the Assemblée Nationale, the controversial pension reform is in the hands of the upper house of Parliament, which is dominated by members of right-wing party Les Républicains.

title: Champions League chaos: UEFA announce refund for Liverpool fans who had tickets for Paris final
description: All 19,618 Liverpool fans who bought tickets for last May's Champions League final are eligible for a refund after the fiasco that marred the match.

title: Kyiv identifies Ukrainian soldier filmed being shot dead
description: The soldier was last seen on February 3, when he was fighting near the eastern Ukrainian city of Bakhmut.

title: UK ready to 'push boundaries of international law' with new bill to to stop Channel migrants
description: Prime Minister Sunak said the 'Illegal Migration Bill' will take back control of UK borders, but critics say the plan is both unethical and unworkable.

title: US defense secretary arrives for unannounced visit to Iraq
description: Lloyd Austin timed his visit ahead days before the 20th anniversary of the US-led invasion that toppled Saddam Hussein.

title: Struggling French weeklies forced to transform business model
description: Due to increased costs, French news magazines are looking for a way to cope with declining circulation.

title: China slams 'hysterical neo-McCarthyism' from the United States
description: China's newly appointed Foreign Minister Qin Gang lashed out at Washington for organizing a 'malicious confrontation.'

title: At Paris Fashion Week, female designers explore their own visions of women
description: Chloé takes inspiration from a female Renaissance painter. Ester Manas plays with marriage codes and Hermès with hair and its symbolism.

title: In eastern DRC, Goma is increasingly isolated
description: In late February, M23 rebels entered Mushaki and Rubaya. The main roads linking the capital of North Kivu to the rest of the province have been cut off.

title: Cambodian opposition leader Kem Sokha sentenced to 27 years in prison
description: The conviction on treason and conspiracy charges comes four months before the parliamentary elections for the former president of the country's largest opposition party.

title: International Women's Day: Gender equality '300 years away,' UN chief warns
description: Antonio Guterres flagged that 'in many places, women's sexual and reproductive rights are being rolled back.'

title: French workers walk out on sixth day of national pension protest
description: Unions are hoping protests against the French government's highly contested pension reform on Tuesday will be their biggest show of force yet.

title: French pension reform: The exceptions of the Paris Opéra and the Comédie-Française
description: The government's reform will not concern the alternative pension programs of the cultural world. Both are in deficit, but they are covered by the state every year.

title: China's Xi condemns US-led 'suppression of China'
description: In a speech at an annual congress in Beijing, the Chinese president condemned the West's 'encirclement' of China, which has caused 'unprecented severe challenges.'

title: French pension reform: 'You break your back, your arms, everything! But it's not considered hardship'
description: The system of taking into account the difficulty of working conditions in calculating retirement is a central concern of those striking against France's proposed reform.

title: Five films from the 1990s to share with your children
description: It's time to hunker down with your kids on the family couch to discover some of the highly rated films of your youth. These feature films provided common references for your generation, and introduced new actors who later broke through.

title: Canada launches probe into Chinese election interference
description: In recent weeks a series of reports in the Canadian media, based on intelligence leaks, have detailed alleged attempts by Beijing to interfere in Canada's last two federal elections.

title: France braces for nationwide strike on March 7 over proposed pension reform
description: On Tuesday, March 7, and perhaps beyond, France will face disruptions from various sectors including transportation, energy and agriculture.

title: In Poitiers, an African restaurant is cherished by its customers but angers its neighbors
description: Gnama Cissé invested all of her savings to open her restaurant. Appreciated by her regulars, the smells of her kitchen inconvenience the landlords of the apartments located above the restaurant, who have taken the chef to court.

title: In Avdiivka, Ukranian soliders 'hold out as long as possible' as Russian air strikes intensify
description: In this city on the eastern front near Donetsk, despite relentless aerial bombardments from the Russian offensive, Ukranian forces have managed to hold off the advance.
